definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Back in the old day, they gave the ill-behaved man a flogging.
sentences.chinese: 过去他们对行为不良的男人，狠狠抽打一顿。

sentences.english: Then they made us sit on our knees again for more than two hours while they whipped us.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们又跪着被他们用皮鞭抽打了两个多小时。
你是否畏惧暴雨的抽打？

sentences.english: There is a searing intensity about the stripe which I have just laid across your arse.
sentences.chinese: 我的这一下抽打让你的屁股感到灼热的感觉。

sentences.english: He switched the boy with a cane.
sentences.chinese: 他用手杖抽打那个小孩。

sentences.english: The slave was leathered black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 那个奴隶被抽打得浑身青紫。

sentences.english: I crouched down in the fork of the tree.
sentences.chinese: 我蹲在树杈上，树枝抽打着我。

sentences.english: The carter flipped at the horse with his whip.
sentences.chinese: 赶大车的人扬鞭朝着马轻轻地抽打。

sentences.english: Then the Nigerian devil comes in and whips you for the rest of the day.
sentences.chinese: 最后尼日利亚恶魔进来用鞭子抽打你，直到过完一天。

sentences.english: Andrew lashed the horses with his whip to make them go faster.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁用鞭子抽打马，要牠们脚步快点。

sentences.english: The gentle flow of warm air gives way to the chilly gust, lashing us.
sentences.chinese: 暖风过后，刺骨的狂风像鞭子抽打一样吹在我们身上。

sentences.english: Therefore, he often whipped the ox to go faster when he arrived in the field.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他一到田里就时常用鞭抽打这头牛快走。

sentences.english: One of the supervisors, age 14, is accused of beating workers with whips.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位被指控用鞭子抽打工人的监工，年仅14岁。

sentences.english: He leathered the slave black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 他用皮鞭把奴隶抽打得浑身青一块紫一块。

sentences.english: The jockey whipped the horse so that it would run faster.
sentences.chinese: 骑师用鞭子抽打马，使牠跑得更快些。

sentences.english: He got the cane for cheating.
sentences.chinese: 他因作弊而受到笞杖抽打。

definition: to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
